messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] request for Australian contacts
messages.msgSnippet: I m unschooling in Victoria.  There is a whole yahoogroup of unschoolers in Australia: http://groups.yahoo.com/group/australianunschoolers/ Mica Thanks Mica!
messages.messageBody:
I'm unschooling in Victoria. There is a whole yahoogroup of
unschoolers in Australia:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/australianunschoolers/

Mica


Thanks Mica!

julie

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] request for Australian contacts
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Julie Reading Sandra s request, I went to have a look at the forum and make contact, wrote out a message but discovered I couldn t send it without being
messages.messageBody:
Hi Julie

Reading Sandra's request, I went to have a look at the forum and make
contact, wrote out a message but discovered I couldn't send it without
being registered, another task I just wasn't ready for, so I decided
not to register & rewrite - but kept the post incase I had time later
- and here you are.

I'm unschooling in Victoria. There is a whole yahoogroup of
unschoolers in Australia: http://groups.yahoo.com/group/australianunschoolers/

Mica


On Fri, 15 Oct 2004 08:45:06 +0800, Julie <mjsolich@...> wrote:
>
>
> ***There wasn't an e-mail address listed, but I thought maybe there would be
> Australians here who might be willing to go to the address below and respond
> to
> this mom!
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> Okay, long shot but are there any Aussies out there? I'm from WA and would
> love to hear from other unschooling Australians.
>
> julie
>
> http://unschooling.info/forum/topic.asp?TOPIC_ID=60 ***
>
> Hey, that's me! mjsolich@... if anyone's interested.
>
> I'm feeling especially bereft this morning as we just found out that the
> kids' best friends are moving in a few weeks after three years of being
> around to play with every week. We're all a bit sad.
>
> julie
>
>
> "List Posting Policies" are provided in the files area of this group.
>
> Visit the Unschooling website and message boards: http://www.unschooling.com
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] request for Australian contacts

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/14/2004 6:50:05 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
mjsolich@... writes:
Hey, that's me! mjsolich@... if anyone's interested.
======

Oh!
Well I guess it won't help for you to write to yourself. DARN. I hoped it
would be an additional/new unschooler.

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] request for Australian contacts
messages.msgSnippet: ***There wasn t an e-mail address listed, but I thought maybe there would be Australians here who might be willing to go to the address below and respond to
messages.messageBody:
***There wasn't an e-mail address listed, but I thought maybe there would be
Australians here who might be willing to go to the address below and respond
to
this mom!

------------------------------------------------------------------------
Okay, long shot but are there any Aussies out there? I'm from WA and would
love to hear from other unschooling Australians.

julie

http://unschooling.info/forum/topic.asp?TOPIC_ID=60 ***

Hey, that's me! mjsolich@... if anyone's interested.

I'm feeling especially bereft this morning as we just found out that the
kids' best friends are moving in a few weeks after three years of being
around to play with every week. We're all a bit sad.

julie

messages.messageBody:
There wasn't an e-mail address listed, but I thought maybe there would be
Australians here who might be willing to go to the address below and respond to
this mom!

Thanks.

Okay, long shot but are there any Aussies out there? I'm from WA and would
love to hear from other unschooling Australians.

julie
